body_html:
The most popular method of get the version one package is as follows.
$ python
>>>import six
>>>print six.__version__
...
>>>import protobuf
>>>print protubuf.__version__

Recently, I have learnt a simple method to get the version of the packages, such as numpy, six and protobuf, like this:
pip show numpy six protobuf

With this method, both the verison and orther detailed information of the package will be presented, so I want to share with you.

body:
The most popular method of get the version one package is as follows.
`$ python`
`>>>import six`
`>>>print six.__version__`
`...`
`>>>import protobuf`
`>>>print protubuf.__version__`

Recently, I have learnt a simple method to get the version of the packages, such as numpy, six and protobuf, like this:
`pip show numpy six protobuf`

With this method, both the verison and orther detailed information of the package will be presented, so I want to share with you.
